meanings.definition: Having artificial body parts that enhance physical abilities.
meanings.sent1: The bionic arm allowed him to lift heavy objects easily.
meanings.sent2: She admired his bionic leg that helped him walk without pain.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's bionic strength made saving the day look effortless.
meanings.sent4: Her bionic eyesight was like having superpowers in real life.
meanings.sent5: The bionic enhancements turned him into a real-life superhero.

meanings.sent1: The scientist's bionic research focused on creating advanced prosthetics.
meanings.sent2: The bionic technology revolutionized the field of medicine.
meanings.sent3: The bionic innovations were so futuristic they seemed like science fiction.
meanings.sent4: Her bionic designs were cutting-edge and ahead of their time.
meanings.sent5: The bionic advancements promised a future of endless possibilities.

meanings.definition: A person with bionic body parts.
meanings.sent1: The bionic was able to run faster than anyone else in the race.
meanings.sent2: She became a bionic after the accident, but it didn't slow her down.
meanings.sent3: The bionic's presence always drew curious looks from passersby.
meanings.sent4: Being a bionic meant embracing a new way of living.
meanings.sent5: The bionic's abilities were a blend of human and machine, creating a unique individual.
